key_responsibilities: manage and coordinate all media and public relations activities
develop integrated communications plans
collaborate effectively with colleagues and implement all public relations strategies
building and expanding the office’s relationships with media outlets
working with the Chief of Staff and Deputy Chief of Staff to develop media strategies
pitching stories and press events to a wide range of media outlets
responding to and managing media inquiries from diverse media outlets
writing op-eds, speeches, press releases, statements and talking points
working with the deputy communications director in Hawaii
maintaining an active social media profile
managing the Member’s official website
requirements: keep up with the fast pace of the office
excellent written and oral communication skills
strong editing and proofreading abilities
develop a keen understanding of the unique priorities and views of the district and find ways to advance the Member’s objectives

key_responsibilities: answering telephones
assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
providing administrative support in setting up committee meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy
requirements: excellent organizational skills and a professional telephone manner
good computer skills
proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests
flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, and financial accounting

position: Counsel in the Office of Advice and Education
key_responsibilities: providing a high volume of ethics advice, education, and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee
Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics, ethics counseling and training, corporate finance, securities law, and criminal law

key_responsibilities: training support staff employees
planning, assigning and directing work of support staff employees
coordinates with Congressman on a daily basis, schedules appointments, events, and manage general demands on the Congressman’s time
prepares weekly schedules for Congressman
provides staff with Congressman’s schedule
manages travel arrangements for Congressman and staff
reviews invitations and prepare responses
coordinates with district staff
manages the MRA
monitors expenditures
pays bills
processes reimbursements
monitors and ensures the Office's compliance with House Rules
maintains and updates an employee handbook and policy manual for the office
provides orientation and training for new staff
assists departing employees with necessary administrative procedures
administers parking space assignments for office
maintains confidential medical files
maintains emergency information sheets for each staff member
maintains leave and time records for the Washington, D.C. staff
manages office supplies for the Washington, D.C. and district offices
orders business cards for the Washington, D.C. and district office staff
supervises the reception desk, mail operations and the administrative files and personnel records
assumes responsibility for overall office appearance and layout
assists the staff in all mass mailings and ensures that quarterly mass mailing reports are filed
maintains borrowing lists and staff borrowing I.D.'s for the Library of Congress
assists staff in scheduling House or Capitol rooms for outside group functions
requirements: at least two years of office management experience
at least one year of working in a congressional office
Alternatively, five years of related work experience
thorough knowledge of the Members' Congressional Handbook and House Rules
ability to perform essential job functions above
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
strong leadership and organizational skills
ability to manage multiple tasks and projects
thoroughness and careful attention to detail
knowledge of office policies, practices and procedures
knowledge of office computer applications
proficiency in word processing

drafting responses to constituent mail and calls for all issue areas
monitoring floor, committee, and regulatory activity
conducting meetings with constituents and stakeholders
developing legislation
advising the Congressman and senior staff
requirements: experience as a Legislative Correspondent
strong writing, organizational, and project management skills

key_responsibilities: handle a diverse portfolio of issues with a particular emphasis on Committee related topics of health care, education and labor issues
briefing the Congressman regarding bills on the floor and policy proposals
Committee prep for hearings and markups
generating policy positions
taking meetings with constituents
helping with constituent correspondence program
requirements: prior legislative experience on Capitol Hill dealing with policy issues
excellent research, writing, and communication skills
confident and well spoken
strong interpersonal skills and a willingness to work in a team environment

key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s schedule in Washington, D.C. and in District
evaluating all meeting requests
coordinating office travel arrangements and special events
requirements: extremely detail oriented
proactive
motivated
flexibility and the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
Prior scheduling experience is preferred

key_responsibilities: Portfolio includes defense, veterans, foreign affairs, homeland security, education, transportation, and science and technology
requirements: positive attitude
sense of humor
excellent written and oral communication skills
significant congressional or public policy experience
